intro: Neoparrya megarrhiza, commonly known as the giant leaved neoparrya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its large, elongated leaves that can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of yellow or white. It is native to the Andes Mountains in South America, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
